intro: Astragalus kadschoroides, commonly known as Kadschore Astragalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found at high altitudes, where it adapts to harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
